thread.title: No Division in Politics.

title: No Division in Politics.
text: Now, in the name of the Muslim community the Hon'ble Mr. Justice Abdur Rahim assures Sir Sankaran Nair that his co-religionists fully share the confidence universally reposed in him and Sir Shankaran has thus received a mandate so to say, jointly from Hindus and Mahomedans to be their spokesman and to press the national claims on the attention of the Government of which he is going to become a part. After this open assurance from the Muslim community no one, not eve a member of the Viceroy's Council, can say that Sir Sankaran Nair does not speak for Mahomedans. Mr. Justice Abdur Rahim specially mentioned the fact that Sir Sankaran was going to take up office when India was becoming united. "For some years," said the learned jurist, "no observer could have failed to perceive that Hindus and Mahomedans and other sections and castes were realising that they were the children of the same soil, that their interest were bound together, and if they were to make progress, they must all unite.
